Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and represent different types of habitats by drawing one land habitat (like a playground, garden, or forest) and one water habitat (like a pond, stream, or lake).

The student can illustrate different kinds of plants and animals in each habitat, such as trees, bushes, grasses, ants, or squirrels in land habitats, and fish, clams, or other aquatic organisms in water habitats.
The student can demonstrate comparisons by showing at least two different types of living things within each habitat.
The student can observe patterns by showing how different habitats have varied plant and animal life.
The student can demonstrate understanding of how to gather information by basing their drawings on firsthand observations or media resources.
